intro: Phagnalon metlesicsii, commonly known as the Armenian phagnalon, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. The flowers, which bloom in the summer, are yellow and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
